The last time CPI had a similar rise to now (right arrow) was 1965 to 1973 (left arrow). The red part followed.

Two things to note.

* 1965 to 1973 is 8 years. The similar rise today took 5 years.

*  January 1973, the stock market was also at an all-time high.

Long-suffering Chicago Bears fan here ... so now they have the best record in the NFC...

Which of these two ways is the correct way to pronounce your support for the Bears?
(both have exactly the same meaning)

"Let's go, Bears!"

"Green Bay Sucks"
Long-bond yield, highest since September 8th (red line)

The 10-year yield has been in a downtrend of lower highs and lower lows since May, highlighted below.

It made its first higher low at the end of November, and now, at 4.14%, it is on the verge of breaking out of this channel.

Will it hold this channel again?

2/2

Since April 2023 (the last 2 1/2 years), the rolling 12-month total of non-DOGE layoffs averaged 720k (dashed blue line). In Nov, it was 901K. This extra 181k above the average is 15k/month in extra ANNOUNCED layoffs.

Is an extra 15K/month in layoffs above its recent average enough to cut the rate by 50 bps (Sept and Oct), and adding another 25 bps cut next week?

Are these 15k/month at risk of losing their job more important than 98 million people who say affordability is the worst they have ever seen (46% of 212 million working age people, per the political poll y'day)?

1/2

The repost stats are ANNOUNCEMENTS, not actual layoffs. They will occur over time and MAY be done through attrition (not filling jobs as people leave).

Orange on this chart shows total layoffs, 1.2m, but ~25% were Gov't (DOGE), meaning the non-DOGE layoffs were 901K.

Investors yanked more than $2.7 billion from the exchange-traded fund over the five weeks to Nov. 28, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. With an additional $113 million of redemptions on Thursday, the ETF is now on pace for a sixth straight week of net outflows.

BloombergNEF now projects data center power demand in the US will reach 106GW by 2035, a 36% increase compared to its projection from just seven months ago. 

$MSFT $AMZN $GOOG $ORCL $NVDA

Oppenheimer on Amazon $AMZN: 

"AWS is planning to double capacity through 2027 after having doubled since 2022, with 'at least' 1GW added in 4Q. 
Our analysis suggests ~$3 billion historical revenue per incremental GW. Applying this to the forward GW forecast with pricng discounts suggests 14%/22% upside to Street 2026/2027 AWS revenue, including 3% upside in 4Q."
I always find my kind!

THE S&P INDEX $SPY IS REBALANCING

CRH $CRH, Carvana $CVNA and Comfort Systems USA $FIX will join the S&P 500, replacing LKQ $LKQ, Solstice Advanced Materials $SOLS and Mohawk Industries $MHK.

Pinterest $PINS, Booz Allen $BAH, SPX Technologies $SPXC and others move into the S&P MidCap 400, while $PRIM, $CWST, $INDV, $HE, $LKQ, $SOLS and $MHK shift to the S&P SmallCap 600.

Effective: Before the market opens on Dec 22, 2025.

Implied volatility on tech stocks is spiking relative to the S&P 500.

This QQQ vs SPY vol spread reflects rising concern that the AI trade may be overheating.

#TechStocks #OptionsTrading

What‚Äôs slowing the S&P 500 from breaking out? One answer may be option hedging.

Short iron condors on zero-day options are popular, and the hedging behind them adds selling pressure as prices rise.

#OptionsEducation $SPX
